title: Dr DisRespect turned down move from Twitch to Mixer, mocks Shroud for leaving
text:
Dr DisRespect seems to be happy where he is

Microsoft may have signed up another high profile streamer for its Mixer service, but Dr Disrespect insists he’s staying with Twitch.

The move of Tyler ‘Ninja’ Blevins from Twitch to Mixer earlier this year was never likely to be Microsoft’s only attempt to poach a major celebrity for their rival streaming service, and now they’ve tempted over Michael ‘Shroud’ Grzesiek. But it seems Dr DisRespect will not next.

Dr DisRespect, real name Herschel Beahm, has mocked what he refers to as Mixer’s low engagement rates and suggested that its long-term prospects are not as good as Twitch’s.

‘Mixer wants to be relevant,’ he said during his latest stream. ‘Their expectation is to mix their little Xbox streams and a space for influencers to grow. They claim 30 million monthly active users but that’s because all of their Xbox users get default Mixer streams. Their engagement is extremely low, trust me.’

But not only did Dr DisRespect claim that he was ‘the first’ to be asked by Microsoft to join Mixer he claims he’s already making more money than either Shroud or Ninja.

That seems unlikely given rumours that Ninja was paid at least $50 million to make the jump, and Shroud was presumably paid something similar, but then again Dr DisRespect’s shtick is, well… disrespecting people.

‘We love Shroud, and we wish him good luck’, he said in a more conciliatory tone.

‘The man got paid. Did he get paid more than the Doctor? Did the guy with the blue hair, the little Dragon Ball Z anime guy, did he get paid more than the Doctor? No, both of them didn’t.’

Whether that’s true, and whether he’d even know, isn’t clear but one thing’s certain: Dr DisRespect isn’t leaving Twitter. At least not until Microsoft up their offer.
